job.title: Microsoft Word Add-in
job.description:
We need to develop a Microsoft Word VSTO Add-in. We would like it done within one month. You will work with our team, according to the documentation we provide.
A short list of technology requirements is as follows. You should have a specific plan for how to implement all of these.

1.	Support any currently officially supported version of Microsoft Office, which seems to be 2016 and later, including 365.
2.	Support any currently officially supported version of Windows, which seems to be Windows 10 1809 or later.
3.	Develop with .Net Framework 4.8 and Visual Studio 2022
4.	Read selected text from document with formatting. Convert selected text into a specific markup language according to formatting. For example, if text is bold, produce [b]text[/b].
5.	Read selected text with formatting while review markup is visible.
6.	Modify selected text, keeping formatting. For example, replace selected formatted text with a table one cell of which contains originally selected text.
7.	Append formatted text into document. Generate it from a specific markup language.
8.	Create a custom ribbon tab.
9.	Put some standard control found on other ribbon tabs on the custom ribbon tab.
10.	Put some custom controls on the custom ribbon tab. For example, radio buttons to switch between different modes.
11.	Update custom controls on the custom ribbon tab instantly when selection changes. For example, change enabled status based on if selected text is inside a table.
12.	Create a task pane.
13.	Update the task pane instantly when selection changes. For example, display number of words in selection if selected text is in Chinese.
14.	Attach custom information to specific sentences, not visible or editable by user, for Add-in internal use only.
15.	Implement OAuth/OpenID Connect authentication against existing backend.
16.	Change color of specific sentences (see #14, #15) based on user identity. For example, some text in a document should be red for John, but blue for Mary.
17.	Create a setup package which will install Add-in itself and all required dependencies/prerequisites. Do not assume anything is already installed. 
18.	The setup package should install optional components, for example, fonts. Components can be quite large, hundredths of megabytes.
19.	The setup package should support execution environments, like test environment, to enable internal testing of the product.
20.	The setup package should support unattended installations for enterprise environments, like SSCM/Intune.
21.	The setup package should support enforced automated updates.
22.	The setup package should support digital signing. At no stage should a customer see “Unknown Publisher” warning.

customFields.generatedDescriptionAI:
We are looking for a skilled developer to create a Microsoft Word Add-in. The project is expected to last for a period of 3 to 6 months. The ideal candidate should have experience working with Windows Forms, Microsoft Visual Studio, .NET Framework, Microsoft Windows, and C#.

As a candidate, we would like you to submit a proposal that outlines how you can help with this project. Please describe your relevant experience and provide details on any similar projects you have completed in the past. Additionally, we would appreciate it if you could include links to these past projects, if available.

We are excited to find a candidate who can contribute their expertise to this project and help us create a seamless Microsoft Word Add-in.
